name: Whole tree chips production; softwood; at sawmill, INW
description: This unit process/ cradle-to-gate dataset represents the production of 1 kg wood chips production from forestry land softwood using Tricon Timber and Tucker Engineering Associate (TEA) system in Missoula, MT. The process technologies are an aggregation of those applied in US Inland Northwest (INW) in 2013.

processDocumentation.timeDescription: On mill production data were gathered using onsite survey in Missoula, MT between July 22-23, 2013. These start and end dates represent the term of the grant funded project not necessarily the temporal validity of the data set.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription:
The process produces whole tree chips, softwood, at sawmill, INW. The process is assumed to represent production in US Inland Northwest (INW), eastern Washington, eastern Oregon, Idaho and western Montana. Data survey was conducted at a wood mill that converting forestry land softwood into wood chips using Tricon Timber and Tucker Engineering Associate (TEA) system in Missoula, MT in 2013. 
The feedstock log resources are consist of 74% from national forests in that area, 8% from MT DNRL, 6% from IDL, and 12% from private party. The wood logs are chipped and screened to micro wood chips (<1.3 cm in the largest dimension) using BM&M chip screens, and dried to 6% using hog fuel in sawdust dryer. 
Feedstock transportation, chipping and screening application, drying with hog fuels. 100% chip production and no allocation applied. Emission to air and water are minor and not included, and other data were collected according to CORRIM guidelines from peer-reviewed literature and in Gu and Bergman (2016). TRACI 2.1 was used for life cycle impact modeling.
processDocumentation.completenessDescription: No environmental emissions data were collected at the mill, the mass data were survey at Montana.
processDocumentation.dataSelectionDescription: Secondary data were taken from the U.S. Life Cycle Inventory Database (National Renewable Energy Laboratory 2016) as distributed via SimaPro 8.4 updated locally 28 April 2015.  Gu and Bergman's cradle-to-gate LCA also used secondary data from the US-EI SimaPro® Library (EARTHSHIFT 2016).
processDocumentation.reviewDetails: NAL LCA Commons Staff reviewed data set documentation for adherence to LCA Commons conventions
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Data represent an aggregation of processes applied in INW in 2013. Data development is demonstrated by parameterization (presents all raw data and calculations). Contact USFS for parameter information.

processDocumentation.intendedApplication: These data were developed as specific, average or generic unit process or LCI results data sets for use in accounting “Accounting” level LCAs (Situation A). A full inventory of environmental flows are included, thus this unit process can be used for a full range of LCIA impact categories, once the appropriate fate and transport considerations have been applied.
processDocumentation.projectDescription: This project was supported by the Biomass Research and Development Initiative, grant no. 2011-10006-30357 from the USDA National Institute of Food and Agriculture.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Inland Northwest: US-MT, US-WA, US-OR, US-ID. Meant to represent operations in eastern Washington, eastern Oregon, Idaho and western Montana.  Actual representative mill sample found in eastern Washington and Idaho only.

exchanges.description:
Average one-way trucking distance to the mill in St. Regis for logs used for whole tree chipping  ~75 miles = 120 km 
-- Survey data from Tricon Timber.  
1 kg *(1-12%)/(1-90%) * 1 ton/1000kg*120km=1.06 tkm.

Average one-way Rail Road distance to the mill in St. Regis for logs used for whole tree chipping  ~245 miles = 395km 
-- Survey data from Tricon Timber.  
1 kg *(1-12%)/(1-90%) * 1 ton/1000kg*395km=3.48 tkm.
